title: Kruw
author: Kruw
content: The previous input record was 400 which was tied by these two coinjoins:084e9f1cff337425c3e66ddb85705f374afc922e9263e5af9099f24316c1f9c0d465033214fd2309dcce5a90c45fcaa788aa4394ee36debe07aad8d8a37907d2After almost 2 years, this ceiling was broken by a 430 input coinjoin: 649344a93bb9859215329100ff4ea4f89b53e5ade700d25c9aeca702c6f74894

comments.author: ABCbits
comments.body: Is it CoinJoin on your Wasabi coordinator? Anyway, it's cool in terms of total input/output and participants. And looking at TX size, there's potential for even more input.

comments.author: Kruw
comments.body: Quote from: ABCbits on October 30, 2024, 09:23:05 AMIs it CoinJoin on your Wasabi coordinator? Yep, I coordinated it.Quote from: ABCbits on October 30, 2024, 09:23:05 AMAnyway, it's cool in terms of total input/output and participants. And looking at TX size, there's potential for even more input.Yeah, it's still less than half of the standard relay limit (100kvb), even bigger coinjoins are possible

comments.author: ellie888
comments.body: Quote from: Kruw on October 29, 2024, 10:25:42 PMThe previous input record was 400 which was tied by these two coinjoins:084e9f1cff337425c3e66ddb85705f374afc922e9263e5af9099f24316c1f9c0d465033214fd2309dcce5a90c45fcaa788aa4394ee36debe07aad8d8a37907d2After almost 2 years, this ceiling was broken by a 430 input coinjoin: 649344a93bb9859215329100ff4ea4f89b53e5ade700d25c9aeca702c6f74894Coinjoins can really make a difference, huh?
